sec.l: pad nām ī yazdān ī kerbakkarān

gloss.gram: "yazdān ī kerbakkarān" takes the plural ending because it is a possesser of nām: "If the possessor is a plural noun, it usually takes the ending -ān" (PP 2). If a plural noun is in the subject position, plurality is indicated by the verb: andar mān dēw būd hēnd “demons were in the house” (PP 1).
gloss.hist: Note similarity to the invocatio of Islamicate texts: "in the name of God..."
